referenceChunks.content: India vs England LIVE: Latest score and updates from final Test of the series in Dharamsala Follow all the action from the final Test of the five-match series in Dharamsala India bowled England out for a below-par 218 and cruised to 135-1 in their robust reply to seize early control of the fifth and final test on Thursday.
referenceChunks.sourceTitle: India vs England LIVE: Latest score and updates from final Test of ...

referenceChunks.content: Kuldeep Yadav wrecked England's top order and fellow spinner Ravichandran Ashwin polished off the tail to bundle out England in just over two sessions.
referenceChunks.sourceTitle: India vs England LIVE: Latest score and updates from final Test of ...

referenceChunks.content: India captain Rohit Sharma combined with Yashasvi Jaiswal (57) in an opening stand of 104 to consolidate their position at the picturesque Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association Stadium in the foothills of the Himalayas.
referenceChunks.sourceTitle: India vs England LIVE: Latest score and updates from final Test of ...

referenceChunks.content: Rohit was batting on 52 at stumps with Shubman Gill (26) also looking assured at the other end.
referenceChunks.sourceTitle: India vs England LIVE: Latest score and updates from final Test of ...

referenceChunks.content: Earlier, Ben Stokes' decision to bat first on a belter of a track was on the expected lines and England got off to a strong start with Zak Crawley and Ben Duckett combining in an opening stand of 64.
referenceChunks.sourceTitle: India vs England LIVE: Latest score and updates from final Test of ...

referenceChunks.content: "He has played really well in this series and he is a good player of spin," said Kuldeep, who claimed 5-72.

referenceChunks.content: "To get him out, you need to produce some magic on the field and that was a beautiful ball and I really loved it."

referenceChunks.content: As the Indian cricketers walked off the pitch on Thursday afternoon after bundling out England for 218 in the first innings of the final Test, Kuldeep Yadav and Mohammed Siraj threw the ball to Ravichandran Ashwin.
referenceChunks.sourceTitle: India vs England Live Score updates, 5th Test Day 2: IND 313/3

referenceChunks.content: They wanted him to lead the side off the field as this was his 100th Test and he claimed a four-fer.
referenceChunks.sourceTitle: India vs England Live Score updates, 5th Test Day 2: IND 313/3

referenceChunks.content: But a generous Ashwin gave the red cherry back to Kuldeep, put his hands on the latter’s shoulders and insisted on him doing the honours, having claimed a fifer and ripping apart England’s batting line-up.
referenceChunks.sourceTitle: India vs England Live Score updates, 5th Test Day 2: IND 313/3

referenceChunks.content: On a day when all of England’s wickets fell to spin at the Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association (HPCA) Stadium, Kuldeep reluctantly agreed to lead the team off the pitch and raised the ball towards the crowd, who chanted his name.
referenceChunks.sourceTitle: India vs England Live Score updates, 5th Test Day 2: IND 313/3
